"Why would you make dvd versions of the tv rips, increasing the filesizes something enormous? "

i can tell you never made a DVD before. do you own any DVD box set like LOST season1? there is 4 episodes on one discs and the box set has 6 discs. now the reason why they can only fix 4 episodes on one disc, is becasuse the episodes have to be in MPG format. each episode on a retail LOST DVD is 1.5GB MPG (are you still following me dipshit?) now i coverted the tv rips into that same format that retail DVDs use. this release is a 4 disc 5 episodes on one disc, and 2 episodes on the last disc. thats only 760MB each episode. now if your dumbass knew anything about DVDs, you would knew that retail DVDs are alot bigger in size. these DVDs are for stand alone DVD players and can be watched on your PC. the small 350MB Avi releases your talking about can only be watched on your PC, and cant be watched on your DVD players. now do you have any more questions SoundWall you dumb shit?
